content:
• Friday, January 13, 2012
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI -3.2%) sold off today after its name failed to appear on Apple's supplier list....

    OmniVision (OVTI -3.2%) sold off today after its name failed to appear on Apple's supplier list. Though it had been widely known that OmniVision had lost iPhone image sensor share to Sony (NYSE:SNE) with the release of the 4S, its non-presence on a list that features dozens of chipmakers suggests its standing with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), known for holding a grudge with suppliers, is worse than previously believed.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Questcor Phaemaceuticals (QCOR +3.4%) rallied a little after stating it would conduct a...

    Questcor Phaemaceuticals (QCOR +3.4%) rallied a little after stating it would conduct a telephone interview with TheStreetSweeper on Monday, ahead of the publishing of a two-part report criticizing the company's business and marketing practices. However, shares are still down about 12% since news of the report broke. What the report will actually say remains a mystery. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -19.3%) rises 6.6% AH, rebounding a bit from the bloodletting it saw after it...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -19.3%) rises 6.6% AH, rebounding a bit from the bloodletting it saw after it was reported its chief engineer and vehicle/chassis engineering chief are leaving. Given that Tesla lacks the scale of larger automakers, the quality of its engineering (responsible for the exceptional range of its electric cars) is crucial to its ability to carve out a niche.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • KEM

    Kemet (NYSE:KEM) -4.6% AH after lowering FQ3 revenue guidance to $217M-$219M vs. previous...

    Kemet (NYSE:KEM) -4.6% AH after lowering FQ3 revenue guidance to $217M-$219M vs. previous estimates of $228M-$238M and $232M consensus. The company says FQ3 order intake was up slightly over FQ2, and believes its market share remains unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • WOOF

    VCA Antech (WOOF +2.7%) finished the day solidly in the green after SunTrust upped the shares to...

    VCA Antech (WOOF +2.7%) finished the day solidly in the green after SunTrust upped the shares to Buy earlier today, citing improved fundamentals in the veterinary services space.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • ENER

    Shares of Energy Conversion Devices (NASDAQ:ENER) surged over 63% today, after the company made...

    Shares of Energy Conversion Devices (NASDAQ:ENER) surged over 63% today, after the company made an interest payment that it had previously deferred on its 3% convertible notes due in 2013, bringing the debt up to current status.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +2.4%) enjoys a boost after B. Riley reiterates its Buy rating, saying investors...

    Netflix (NFLX +2.4%) enjoys a boost after B. Riley reiterates its Buy rating, saying investors should hold on to their shares until after the company's Q4 conference call on Jan. 25. Netflix's customer base appears to be stabilizing, Riley says. which should reassure investors that the company is holding its own against the competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 9 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -10.2%) plummets after 2 executives leave ahead of the mid-year debut of the...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -10.2%) plummets after 2 executives leave ahead of the mid-year debut of the company's latest car. Blue Phoenix's John Licata says one of the departing execs is the firm's chief engineer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • BTH

    Blyth (BTH +12.3%) jumps after saying its agreed to buy the remaining interest of its ViSalus...

    Blyth (BTH +12.3%) jumps after saying its agreed to buy the remaining interest of its ViSalus Holdings unit in an all-stock transaction. Prior to the purchase the company had held an approximate 71.7% interest in ViSalus.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AXLL

    Georgia Gulf (GGC +34%) trades nearly 10% higher than the $30/share offer from Westlake Chemical...

    Georgia Gulf (GGC +34%) trades nearly 10% higher than the $30/share offer from Westlake Chemical (WLK +7.6%), lending credence to comments by Telly Zachariades that he wouldn't be surprised to see a higher bid. The banker says M&A activity in the chemical sector will pick up steam in 2012 because of ample cash on the balance sheets of many big players.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • SEAC

    Shares of SeaChange International (SEAC -2.1%) fall off to a 52-week low on heavy volume. Late...

    Shares of SeaChange International (SEAC -2.1%) fall off to a 52-week low on heavy volume. Late word that CFO Kevin Brisson resigned actually perked up shares a bit from their doldrums.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +13.3%) pop after an analyst from Craig Hallum comments that its new HD...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +13.3%) pop after an analyst from Craig Hallum comments that its new HD InvisibleShield offering is an anchor product for the company, and it may be locking in Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) as a customer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • AVB

    AvalonBay Communities (AVB +1.8%) ticks firmly in the green after Macquarie upped the shares to...

    AvalonBay Communities (AVB +1.8%) ticks firmly in the green after Macquarie upped the shares to Outperform on valuation earlier today, citing its potential for "superior" growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • EA

    NPD's weak December data for U.S. retail video game sales is hurting Electronic Arts (EA -6.3%)...

    NPD's weak December data for U.S. retail video game sales is hurting Electronic Arts (EA -6.3%) even more than GameStop (GME -2.7%). The selloff demonstrates how, in spite of its efforts to diversify into mobile, social, and massively multiplayer games, EA still remains very sensitive to the ups and downs of the traditional console market.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • TWI

    Titan International (TWI +1.8%) ticks higher today after Oppenheimer ups the stock to...

    Titan International (TWI +1.8%) ticks higher today after Oppenheimer ups the stock to Outperform, citing capacity expansions and the company's strong farm business
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • GUID

    Guidance Software (GUID +3.6%) catches a bid after announcing it added 98 new customers in Q4...

    Guidance Software (GUID +3.6%) catches a bid after announcing it added 98 new customers in Q4 for its EnCase Enterprise suite of applications for conducting investigations related to computer data. Guidance's list of 2011 customer additions includes Facebook, 3M, U.S. Bancorp, and The Gap.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • CTRP

    Chinese travel service provider Ctrip.com (CTRP +1.9%) moves higher, as options activity...

    Chinese travel service provider Ctrip.com (CTRP +1.9%) moves higher, as options activity suggests at least one strategist expects shares to extend gains in the near term. Susquehanna upgrades CTRP to Positive from Neutral with a $37 target price: the stock has plummeted more than 50% off its 52-week high of $50.57 set in April.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • PBH

    Prestige Holdings (PBH -2.5%) announces a plan to offer a private placement of $290M of new...

    Prestige Holdings (PBH -2.5%) announces a plan to offer a private placement of $290M of new senior notes to help finance the acquisition of 17 OTC drug brands from GlaxoSmithKline and retire existing debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN -4.8%) and Takeda Pharmaceutical (TKPYY.PK -1.00%) dip after the FDA says...

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN -4.8%) and Takeda Pharmaceutical (TKPYY.PK -1.00%) dip after the FDA says it's seen three cases of serious brain infection among patients being treated with their jointly-produced lymphoma drug Adcetris, and strengthened the drug's warning label.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • MET

    MetLife (MET -2.5%) shares slump after Raymond James lowers its rating on the insurer to Market...

    MetLife (MET -2.5%) shares slump after Raymond James lowers its rating on the insurer to Market Perform from Strong Buy after rising 15% YTD. The cut reflects "a relative lack of upside, following strong share price outperformance, compared with the shares of other life insurers," the firm says. PRU -0.4%, LNC -2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • ESS

    Essex Property Trust (ESS +3.1%) says Q4 net operating income climbed 11% Y/Y as Southern...

    Essex Property Trust (ESS +3.1%) says Q4 net operating income climbed 11% Y/Y as Southern California continues to recover from its economic doldrums. FFO is now estimated to range from $6.50 to $6.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • SWY

    Safeway (SWY +1.6%) catches a bid in a weak market after being upgraded to Buy at Jefferies,...

    Safeway (SWY +1.6%) catches a bid in a weak market after being upgraded to Buy at Jefferies, citing improving economic trends in California where the grocer is heavily entrenched.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM -3.7%) takes a hit after D.A. Davidson cut the shares to Neutral earlier today on...

    Akamai (AKAM -3.7%) takes a hit after D.A. Davidson cut the shares to Neutral earlier today on valuation, citing risk to its Q1 earnings due to sluggish sales growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • BKU

    Bloomberg reports BankUnited (NYSE:BKU) is exploring a sale. Shares sky, +11.4%.

    Bloomberg reports BankUnited (NYSE:BKU) is exploring a sale. Shares sky, +11.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • CIEN

    Shares of Ciena (CIEN -2.2%) give back a little today, despite an earlier upgrade to Outperform...

    Shares of Ciena (CIEN -2.2%) give back a little today, despite an earlier upgrade to Outperform by Northland. The stock has been on a Santa Claus rally of its own recently, running up nearly 40% since late-December. Northland says there's significant revenue and margin upside for the company over the next couple years, and the rally isn't even close to being over.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • POL

    KeyBanc upgrades PolyOne (POL +2.4%) to Buy from Hold, citing attractive long-term cyclical...

    KeyBanc upgrades PolyOne (POL +2.4%) to Buy from Hold, citing attractive long-term cyclical upside potential and a positive outlook for margin improvement. Analysts with the firm set a $17 price target - repping 30% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • CPNO

    Copano Energy (CPNO -4.2%) says it's priced its 5M unit public offering at $34.03, a 3.8%...

    Copano Energy (CPNO -4.2%) says it's priced its 5M unit public offering at $34.03, a 3.8% discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • CREE

    LED chip/component maker Cree (CREE -2.8%), which is coming off a difficult 2011, sees renewed...

    LED chip/component maker Cree (CREE -2.8%), which is coming off a difficult 2011, sees renewed selling pressure today after Wunderlich reiterates a Sell, arguing estimates remain too high. Sterne Agee is reiterating a Buy, but expects Cree's FQ2 revenue and EPS to come in at the low end of its guidance range. Shares rallied yesterday on an upgrade from Kaufman Bros.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • CPY

    Portrait studio operator CPI Corp. (CPY -1.5%) says same-store holiday sales sank amid weakness...

    Portrait studio operator CPI Corp. (CPY -1.5%) says same-store holiday sales sank amid weakness in its PictureMe Portrait Studio and Sears Portrait Studio brands. The company runs about 3,000 portrait photography studios, with most of its locations in Sears (SHLD -0.2%) and Wal-Mart (WMT -0.6%) stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • WBA

    A union benefits fund has filed a class-action suit against Walgreen (WAG) and generic drugmaker...

    A union benefits fund has filed a class-action suit against Walgreen (WAG) and generic drugmaker Par Pharmaceutical (NYSE:PRX), accusing them of carrying out "at least two widespread schemes to overcharge" for drugs. The lawsuit claims a variety of parties were charged 2x-4x as much as they should have been for the filling of prescriptions involving Par's drugs. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • AFFX

    Affymetrix (AFFX -2.4%) announces a collaboration with BGI to expand research and molecular...

    Affymetrix (AFFX -2.4%) announces a collaboration with BGI to expand research and molecular breeding tools for enhancing plant, crop, and livestock production outcomes.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • WBMD

    Don't get sore, buy some more appears to be the operating paradigm for Carl Icahn after the...

    Don't get sore, buy some more appears to be the operating paradigm for Carl Icahn after the breakdown in shares of WebMD (WBMD +2.1%) following the firm's 2012 revenue warning. New SEC filings reveal the investor increased his stake in WBMD on weakness throughout the week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • EV

    Eaton Vance (EV -2.6%) says assets under management declined in Q4 to $184.5B, down from $188.2B...

    Eaton Vance (EV -2.6%) says assets under management declined in Q4 to $184.5B, down from $188.2B at the end of October, 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (SODA +6%) gets a boost from postive comments out of Oppenheimer today. The firm says...

    Sodastream (SODA +6%) gets a boost from postive comments out of Oppenheimer today. The firm says that after meeting with management, it remains confident in the company's outlook and that it's poised for solid growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • SAP

    As SAP (SAP +2.2%) rallies after delivering better-than-expected Q4 results, comparisons between...

    As SAP (SAP +2.2%) rallies after delivering better-than-expected Q4 results, comparisons between the business software giant's strong performance and archrival Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) FQ2 shortfall are hard to avoid. Also raising eyebrows is SAP's claim it generated €160M in 2011 sales for its Hana analytics database (popular for big data applications), blowing past a €100M target. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • GWR

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR -2.2%) slips after reporting anemic traffic numbers for December,...

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR -2.2%) slips after reporting anemic traffic numbers for December, largely due to fewer coal shipments. Q4 traffic did rise 7.9% overall when recent acquisitions are factored in, but when excluded railroad traffic actually slid 0.4% in the recent quarter, and December traffic was down 1% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • RGR

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (RGR +7.1%) take flight, helped along with an announcement from the firm...

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (RGR +7.1%) take flight, helped along with an announcement from the firm that it booked a positive number of gun sales as part of an initiative with the NRA.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVI

    Oil refiner CVR Energy (CVI +2.5%) outperforms after it's learned Carl Icahn has acquired a 3.5%...

    Oil refiner CVR Energy (CVI +2.5%) outperforms after it's learned Carl Icahn has acquired a 3.5% stake in the company. CVR has responded to the news by issuing a brief statement in which it claims to "welcome the views of all shareholders."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • NE

    Shares of Noble Corp. (NE +2.6%) buck the negative tide after a fleet contract status update...

    Shares of Noble Corp. (NE +2.6%) buck the negative tide after a fleet contract status update shows North Sea July 2012-July 2013 dayrates of $122K. Tudor Pickering Holt says NE won a positive deepwater drilling rate with Royal Dutch Shell in the Gulf of Mexico, but cuts its Q4 EPS estimate to $0.47 from $0.56 because of rig downtime and delayed deliveries.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • VMW

    As Citigroup downgrades VMware (VMW -3.9%) to Sell, it also raises Citrix (CTXS -0.9%) to Buy,...

    As Citigroup downgrades VMware (VMW -3.9%) to Sell, it also raises Citrix (CTXS -0.9%) to Buy, as "hard work on jump-starting new demand, prodding the installed base, reinvigorating legacy XenApp and building out the technology stack is resulting in more consistent, albeit modest desktop growth." Share prices don't reflect virtualization business CTXS may get from cloud computing infrastructure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +2%) moves up again today on heavy volume over talk that Chevron (CVX...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +2%) moves up again today on heavy volume over talk that Chevron (CVX -0.1%) may be an interested buyer in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 1 Comment

  • Shares of Zagg ([[ZAGG}] +13.1%) soar on rumor of a major distribution deal with Wal-Mart that...

    Shares of Zagg ([[ZAGG}] +13.1%) soar on rumor of a major distribution deal with Wal-Mart that will be announced soon.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • JDAS

    JDA Software's (JDAS -12.3%) Q4 warning could be a red flag for both IT spending and the U.S....

    JDA Software's (JDAS -12.3%) Q4 warning could be a red flag for both IT spending and the U.S. retail industry: during an earnings call that followed the warning, the company primarily blamed the shortfall on retailers halting orders for JDA's supply-chain management software in an attempt to trim expenses in response to weak margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -4.2%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cut its rating on the shares to Hold,...

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -4.2%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cut its rating on the shares to Hold, citing a diminished outlook for natural gas prices. The firm notes that 96% of the company's volumes are in natural gas, so it's likely management will have to cut spending plans if prices remain near or below current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 2 Comments
  • PLCE

    Bank of America pulls a 180 on Children's Place (PLCE +3.3%), changing its stance to Buy from a...

    Bank of America pulls a 180 on Children's Place (PLCE +3.3%), changing its stance to Buy from a lowly Underperform rating. The about-face from BofA comes less than two weeks after the specialty retailer slashed Q4 guidance on discounting pressures and high costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • BYI

    Bally Technologies (BYI +2.6%) sees upward movement after landing an upgrade from Citigroup to...

    Bally Technologies (BYI +2.6%) sees upward movement after landing an upgrade from Citigroup to Buy from Neutral. The firm improves its stance on Bally on the strength of analysis after digesting financials and anecdotal evidence from slot managers that systems revenue could increase 37% over the next two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • OXM

    Brean Murray reiterates its Buy rating on Oxford Industries (OXM +1.4%) and raises its price...

    Brean Murray reiterates its Buy rating on Oxford Industries (OXM +1.4%) and raises its price target to $55 from $46 following an upbeat presentation at a conference. "With management commenting that sales momentum and full price selling remained strong throughout the holidays and inventory levels were muted, we think it is still time to be aggressive," Brean says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (JASO -6.9%) trades lower after being cut to Underperform at Raymond James, citing the...

    JA Solar (JASO -6.9%) trades lower after being cut to Underperform at Raymond James, citing the company's heavy exposure to shipping cells rather than full modules.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • CMG

    William Blair joins the Chipotle (CMG +2.2%)-loving crowd, upgrading shares to Outperform from...

    William Blair joins the Chipotle (CMG +2.2%)-loving crowd, upgrading shares to Outperform from Market Perform. It's getting harder to find people that don't like CMG (or their food for that matter), with only 2 of 28 analysts covering the stock ringing up a Sell or Underweight rating on shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan's (JPM -4%) so-so Q4 prompts analysts to predict shares will drift after popping higher...

    JPMorgan's (JPM -4%) so-so Q4 prompts analysts to predict shares will drift after popping higher to open the new year. Nomura is typical:"Things are fine at JPM, but given the ~11% run-up in the stock YTD and no near-term relief in sight for issues in Europe, the big mortgage tail or pick up in capital markets, our gut is JPM and many other financials take a breather in the near term." XLF -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • AG

    First Majestic (AG -4.4%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral at UBS on valuation. The stock...

    First Majestic (AG -4.4%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral at UBS on valuation. The stock has been a strong performer as of late, gaining over 26% just since mid-December.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • MJN

    Shares of Mead Johnson (MJN -1.8%) trickle lower as rival Synutra (SYUT +10.8%) confirms the...

    Shares of Mead Johnson (MJN -1.8%) trickle lower as rival Synutra (SYUT +10.8%) confirms the safety of its infant formula after an investigation of a baby's death in China raised questions. Despite sounding the "all-clear" on its own formula, Mead has been bouncing around in a lower trading range than prior to the Enfamil scare.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • DMND

    KeyBanc downgrades Diamond Foods (DMND -9.5%) to Hold following a report the controversy-laden...

    KeyBanc downgrades Diamond Foods (DMND -9.5%) to Hold following a report the controversy-laden nut vendor is being investigated by the DOJ - an event that could put its Pringles purchase at risk. While believing Diamond's management "will be vindicated" and considering shares to be undervalued, KeyBanc considers it "impossible to defend the stock" given all the investigations currently afoot.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 10 Comments
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal's (PCX -6.8%) warning triggers a broader selloff in coal stocks. ANR -7.6%. BTU...

    Patriot Coal's (PCX -6.8%) warning triggers a broader selloff in coal stocks. ANR -7.6%. BTU -3.3%. CNX -3.8%. JRCC -7.6%. ACI -6.9%. The fact the warning was related to the production of high-end coal used for steelmaking is likely to raise fears of slowing global industrial output.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM

  • Stocks and the euro take a new leg down on chatter negotiators are losing confidence a...

    Stocks and the euro take a new leg down on chatter negotiators are losing confidence a restructuring deal can be worked out for Greece's debt. As a reminder, Greece awaits an €89B bailout tranche, without which it will faces an imminent hard default. The IMF/EU has said it will not release that tranche unless a restructuring deal has been sealed. The euro hits a new multi-year low at $1.2649.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • ACW

    Shares of Accuride (ACW -4.2%) slide lower after the firm catches an initiation from BB&T at...

    Shares of Accuride (ACW -4.2%) slide lower after the firm catches an initiation from BB&T at Hold. ACW has now given back all of its early 2012 gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • GME

    GameStop (GME -2.3%) heads lower after NPD reports U.S. retail sales of video game hardware and...

    GameStop (GME -2.3%) heads lower after NPD reports U.S. retail sales of video game hardware and software fell 28% and 14% Y/Y, respectively, in December. For all of 2011, hardware sales fell 11%, and software sales 6%, as online and mobile gaming took their toll, and the current generation of consoles showed its age. The Xbox 360 (NASDAQ:MSFT) was easily the best-performing console, accounting for 49% of 2011 retail console spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • ACTG

    Acacia Research (ACTG +2.3%) trades higher after the firm announces the acquisition of 4G tech...

    Acacia Research (ACTG +2.3%) trades higher after the firm announces the acquisition of 4G tech developer Adaptix for $160M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • SAP

    SAP (SAP +2.4%) shares rise after reporting Q4 earnings that beat analysts’ estimates....

    SAP (SAP +2.4%) shares rise after reporting Q4 earnings that beat analysts’ estimates. Operating profit was €1.78B ($2.3B) under accounting standards the company uses for its own forecasts, vs. €1.73B consensus. Revenue from software and software-related services rose 13% Y/Y to €3.72B at constant currencies, also topping estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sharply higher in a red tape is Sears (SHLD +2.3%) after its chairman and largest shareholder,...

    Sharply higher in a red tape is Sears (SHLD +2.3%) after its chairman and largest shareholder, Eddie Lampert, reports buying about $130M in shares from his own fund, ESL Investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • RDN

    Radian (RDN +5%) says its primary mortgage insurance subsidiary wrote new business worth $6.5B...

    Radian (RDN +5%) says its primary mortgage insurance subsidiary wrote new business worth $6.5B in Q4 2011 and expects to maintain its risk-to-capital ratio below the 25:1 maximum limit. In November, the company had said it expected to write new business in excess of $5B for the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW) falls 3.3% after Citi downgrades the company to Sell. While noting the high...

    VMware (NYSE:VMW) falls 3.3% after Citi downgrades the company to Sell. While noting the high priority CIOs assign to virtualization in surveys, the firm thinks VMware's one-off software licensing model, dependence on hardware upgrade cycles, and relatively high Euro exposure leave it vulnerable should IT spending conditions worsen, as some industry players and observers forecast (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • AXLL

    Premarket gainers: GGC +36%. RDN +7%. APOG +4%. SAP +3%.Losers: EK -20%. DMND -9%. SFLY -8%. PCX...

    Premarket gainers: GGC +36%. RDN +7%. APOG +4%. SAP +3%.
    Losers: EK -20%. DMND -9%. SFLY -8%. PCX -8%. SGEN -6%. JASO -6%. TSL -5%. GFA-OLD -4%. JPM -4%. BAC -4%. ALU -4%. VOD -4%. CPNO -4%. VMW -4%. MS -4%. C -4%. ANR -4%. HOV -3%. YGE -3%. TS -3%. RCL -3%. BUD -3%. RF -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • AXLL

    Georgia Gulf Corp. (GGC) rises 32%, to $24.48, after rival Westlake Chemical (NYSE:WLK) submits...

    Georgia Gulf Corp. (GGC) rises 32%, to $24.48, after rival Westlake Chemical (NYSE:WLK) submits a proposal to acquire the company for $30/share in cash. Georgia Gulf's current trading price suggests investors expect a higher bid to arrive. Westlake says a $30/share deal would be accretive to its earnings in the first fiscal year following the deal's closing.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Reuters adds to the rumors, saying its senior eurozone sources expect several downgrades of EU...

    Reuters adds to the rumors, saying its senior eurozone sources expect several downgrades of EU countries today, but Germany isn't one of them. Stoxx 50 now -0.6%, euro -0.9% at $1.2694 (a few hours ago, it was set to rise above $1.29).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX) -6.6% premarket after saying it will cut production of metallurgical coal...

    Patriot Coal (PCX) -6.6% premarket after saying it will cut production of metallurgical coal used to make steel due to weakening demand.
